title: Troubles rendering a live video feed
body:
I'm using SkiaSharp on a Linux/Gtk platform, .NET core 2.1 (and this Gtk binding: https://github.com/gtksharp/gtksharp).

At the moment, I'm trying to render a live video feed inside of an `SkWidget`.  At first (to test things out), I was getting my video source when `SkWidget.PaintSurface` was invoked.  Therefore it was running in the Gtk GUI thread (which is a bad idea), and it worked.  It was able to render video in realtime and retrieve it from the source.

The only problem with this was that the video source was from a USB, therefore it was quite slow, and would make the Gtk UI much less responsive (since capture was happing in the GUI thread).

I tried moving the capture over to a `System.Timers.Timer` callback, and added in all of the necessary locks/syncing.  This would work for about 10-15 seconds (GUI was response, `SkWiget` was showing a live feed), the GUI would then freeze up.  I tried using various things, such as Double-Buffered `SkBitmap`s, standard locks, Spin Locks, Reader-Writer locks, etc.

I'm wondering if there is a proper/recommended way of rendering video w/ Skia.  Is there?
